title: Chili Crisp
source: A Very Chinese Cookbook - Kevin Pang
categories: A Very Chinese Cookbook - Kevin Pang
ingredients: - ½ cup salted dry-roasted peanuts, chopped
- 1 (1-inch) piece ginger, sliced into ¼-inch-thick rounds and smashed
directions: Directions:1. Combine chili flakes, peanuts, peppercorns, salt, and MSG (if using) in a heatproof bowl and set a fine-mesh strainer over the bowl.

2. In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, cook the vegetable oil and shallots, stirring frequently, until the shallots are deep golden brown, 10 to 14 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer shallots to a second bowl.
3. Add garlic to the hot oil and cook, stirring constantly, until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, transfer garlic to the bowl with shallots.

4. Add ginger, star anise, cardamom, and cinnamon sticks to the oil. Reduce heat to medium and cook, stirring occasionally, until the ginger is dried out and the mixture is very fragrant, 15 to 20 minutes.
5. Strain the mixture through the fine-mesh strainer into the bowl with the chili flake mixture (mixture may bubble slightly); discard the solids. Stir well to combine.
6. Once cooled, stir in the fried shallots, garlic, and sesame oil. Transfer to a container and let sit for at least 12 hours before using.
